metadata.h1: Visualize from Text for COVID-19 Cases Update from Slack Bot
metadata.description: How great would it be if we could see all the COVID-19 information in one place? In this article, we will look into how to develop a system that could provide COVID-19 cases updates across the world…

all_paragraphs: How great would it be if we could see all the COVID-19 information in one place? In this article, we will look into how to develop a system that could provide COVID-19 cases updates across the world by asking natural questions.

Many of us have heard about the Alexa device, but some use it regularly. It tries to interpret the text through a high-level machine learning workflow. We will build something that is similar to Alexa in skills that could answer relevant questions.

We will create the COVID-19 Tracker Bot in which it tries to understand multiple intents, extract the Named Entity Recognition (NER) values, implementing a custom COVID-19 visual response, and has Slack integration.

RASA chatbot framework provides the simplest way of connecting with the Slack App. Let’s see what is going on behind the scenes of the RASA chatbot. Human text is passed as the input to the pipeline in the RASA framework to perform Natural Language Processing (NLP) operations. The below is the sample configurable NLP pipeline in RASA for identifying the intent of the utterance.
Named Entity Recognition (NER) is one of the popular NLP tasks. To get the specific NER from text will use Spacy, duckling provided by wit.ai, and custom entities using CRF entity extractor (RASA).

Next, how do we generate a dynamic visual response for RASA Bot? Yes, it is possible with the custom actions using RASA. RASA provides a custom action server to implement specific business logic for the bot to respond. Our COVID-19 tracker logic will get implemented in the custom actions. Custom COVID-19 bot response will have image output. However, the slack app will recognize an image only if the image accessible from the public URL. Hence, it is required to include a public URL image from the RASA bot response.

How do I serve the COVID-19 visual image to the Slack app? A simple flask web application used here. The entire solution deployed in the AWS EC2 instance. RASA custom actions generate image output and saved under static folder in the flask app directory. Slack use this flask endpoint URL for accessing the image. Below is the sample flask code.
In the above examples, every sentence is called utterance. RASA framework performs intent classification and entity recognition as specified in the configuration pipeline. Let’s see each topic below:

Intent classification is one of the powerful modules in chatbot. It is a classification problem where input text needs to classify. RASA provides various classification algorithms to perform intent identification. Each intent is associated with specific actions to perform.
We need to identify location names, dates, and custom entities as COVID case types (active, confirmed, recovered, and deaths). The below libraries are used in our pipeline:

The Spacy library is used here to identify location names such as India, the USA, China, Australia. There are different pre-trained models available to use. You can check the spacy NER demo here. You can use Spacy NER in your RASA pipeline as follows,
We have the option to choose the pre-trained model and what kind of entity to extract from the utterance. We specified LOC and GPE entities for identifying location names.

Duckling is a Haskell library that parses text into structured data. Facebook has developed a duckling library. It can handle multiple entities such as time, date, duration, distance, amount, temperature, quantity. In our scenario, we are using for extracting date info from the text. You can use duckling NER in your RASA pipeline as follows,
How to install the duckling library?
Duckling runs on 8000port. You can mention the duckling URL in your RASA pipeline and specific entity names.

Conditional Random Field (CRF) is a component of the RASA framework to identify the custom entities. We are using to identify custom entities such as corona status (confirmed, active, recovered, and deaths). RASA framework trains the custom entities on its own.

Now, how do we generate visual output as per given human text? As of now, we interpreted intent, entities from text. It helps us to implement custom COVID-19 Tracker logic. There are COVID-19 open-source API available on the internet where it provides every country level info. We will use the COVID-19 information from the API to plot the visual output.
